p: Converts a basic Markdown file into a CSV file.

usage: main.py [-h] [-o OUTPUT] [-p {markdown,pypandoc}] [-v] input

Convert Markdown file to CSV.

positional arguments:
  input                 Markdown file to convert

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Name of output file
  -p {markdown,pypandoc}, --parser {markdown,pypandoc}
                        Markdown parser to use
  -v, --verbose         Increase output verbosity

Note: Make sure to have the required dependencies
installed for the chosen parser. Refer to the requirements.txt file.

This command will convert the README.md file to a CSV
file using the default pypandoc parser.
This will save the converted CSV file as output.csv.
You can choose between two parser options:

Markdown Parser (markdown): A
lightweight parser using the Python markdown library.
Suitable for simple conversions. Sample Output
Pypandoc Parser (pypandoc): A more
extensive parser using the pypandoc library, which
wraps Pandoc. Suitable for complex Markdown files. Sample Output

# Using the markdown parser
python main.py input.md --parser markdown

# Or using the pypandoc parser (default)
python main.py input.md --parser pypandoc
Add the -v flag to enable verbose logging.

Feel free to open an issue or
submit a pull
request if you find a bug or have suggestions for improvements.
